description: Complete application startup and initial render verification
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the application root URL
Step 2: Wait for the page to fully load (check document.readyState)
Step 3: Verify the main trading interface is displayed
Step 4: Verify no JavaScript errors in console
Step 5: Verify header section renders with logo and navigation
Step 6: Verify chart panel renders with loading state or data
Step 7: Verify order book panel renders with bid/ask columns
Step 8: Verify recent trades panel renders
Step 9: Verify order entry panel renders with form fields
Step 10: Verify bottom panel with tabs renders
Step 11: Verify WebSocket connection status indicator is visible

description: Header component displays logo, asset selector, and wallet connect button
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the application
Step 2: Verify logo is displayed on the left side of header
Step 3: Verify asset selector dropdown is present
Step 4: Verify wallet connect button is displayed on the right
Step 1: Navigate to the application
Step 2: Click on the asset selector dropdown
Step 3: Verify dropdown opens showing list of trading pairs
Step 4: Verify each pair shows coin name and relevant market data
Step 5: Type 'BTC' in the search field
Step 6: Verify only BTC-related pairs are shown
Step 7: Clear the search field
Step 8: Verify all pairs are shown again
Step 9: Type a non-existent pair name
Step 10: Verify 'No results' message is displayed
Step 11: Click outside dropdown
Step 12: Verify dropdown closes

Step 5: Verify chart updates with new pair data

description: WebSocket auto-reconnect after connection loss full flow
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the application and verify connection
Step 2: Verify data is flowing via WebSocket
Step 3: Simulate network disconnection
Step 4: Verify connection status shows disconnected (red)
Step 5: Verify UI displays reconnecting message
Step 6: Restore network connection
Step 7: Wait for reconnection attempt (up to 5 seconds)
Step 8: Verify WebSocket reconnects successfully
Step 9: Verify connection status returns to connected (green)
Step 10: Verify data flow resumes with correct values
Step 11: Verify no data loss or corruption occurred
Step 1: Navigate to order book panel
Step 2: Verify bid prices are shown on left/bottom (green)
Step 3: Verify ask prices are shown on right/top (red)
Step 4: Verify prices are sorted correctly (descending for bids, ascending for asks)
Step 5: Verify each price level shows size column
Step 6: Verify sizes are displayed in appropriate decimal precision
Step 7: Verify total cumulative volume is displayed
Step 8: Verify depth bars are displayed behind price levels
Step 9: Verify bid depth bars are green-shaded
Step 10: Verify ask depth bars are red-shaded
Step 11: Verify bar length corresponds to cumulative volume
Step 12: Verify prices update in real-time

steps: Step 1: Navigate to order book panel
Step 2: Locate spread display between bid and ask sections
Step 3: Verify spread shows absolute price difference
Step 4: Verify spread percentage is also displayed
Step 5: Verify spread updates in real-time
